Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: I can personally bump up the price of kmd right now with a few thousand dollars. It used to be much easier. But to say that there is some macroeconomic entropy protecting the btc market from manipulation... I think you need to look at the sheer amount of power some of the whales have now.   Manipulation happens everyday in this market. It's routine and more often than not I personally believe it is successful at getting whatever albeit temporary effect is sought with the price.

Author: allbits#5898
Content:
You THINK you can bump the KMD price right now for a few thousand dollars. It might turn out not to be true if, for example, I was simultaneously attempting to lower it with a few more thoudabd dollars than you.. You don't know how high you would push it with any reasonable accuracy, nor how long it would stay up, nor where it might settle after your operation. You would be guessing all these things and there would be a huge margin for error. You would have no certain path to profit from such an operation. These are my points. Understand yet?

I agree there is ATTEMPTED manipulation in all markets. But the larger the market, the more complex it is, the more number of players there are competing to fleece each other, and the less likely any attempted manipulation can be successful in achieving its goal of profit, unless there is wide ranging collusion of a substantial number of the largest players.  Again, I am parroting settled market theory here. I.do understand that it's just conceptually simpler, and more cinematic, to think that individual minds are pulling all the strings on markets. It's a common misconception of uniformed market observers.
